The barriers preventing French people from going on vacation
description: Between 20% and 40% of French people are unable to take at least one week of holiday away from home every year, due to financial, psychological and logistical obstacles. The organizations that try to help them are starting to suffer the effects of the economic climate.

Why air-dropping aid will never stop famine in Gaza
description: Historian Jean-Pierre Filiu explains in his column that food air drops, already tested in Gaza in March 2024, serve more to soothe public opinion than to genuinely alleviate the suffering of the Palestinian population.

headline: Trade war: 'The Americans are the ones paying for the tariffs'
description: Gilles Moëc, chief economist at AXA, argues that while tariffs take time to affect the real economy, they are likely to have recessionary effects in both the US and Europe.

headline: Child-free weddings: 'I would rather she not come at all than have to accept everyone's children'
description: For French couples' big day, celebrations where children are not permitted are becoming increasingly common.

headline: At Michel and Sébastien Bras' restaurant, a taste for the world passes from father to son
description: 'Chefs' Gardens' (5/5). The father-son duo have brought back countless varieties of plants from their travels abroad, showcasing them in their dishes at Le Suquet, their restaurant in southern France.

China's 'Dalifornia,' a bohemian haven for young people searching for meaning
description: In the southern Yunnan province, Dali is the city of those who say 'no' in silence. This somewhat hipster haven has welcomed more and more young people eager to escape the crushing megacities of a country where growth is sputtering. This gentle form of opposition has not gone unnoticed by the authorities.

headline: 'In Germany, the punks made music to express themselves': Mark Reeder, an avant-garde night owl
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (6/6). In the late 1970s, as English pop dominated the world, Mark Reeder instead swore by German electronic music. He left his native Manchester at 20 to discover Berlin, its clubs and its music.

headline: In Monaco, chef Marcel Ravin's Creole garden
description: 'Chefs' Gardens' (3/5). Since 2022, the Martinique-born chef, who has been awarded two Michelin stars, has planted Caribbean varieties within the Monegasque palace that houses his fine dining restaurant.
